headline: Denmark international Mille Gejl joins Crystal Palace Women
summary: Crystal Palace’s second signing of the day is Denmark international forward Mille Gejl from NWSL side North Carolina Courage. She has 32 caps and seven goals for her country, played for the likes of Brøndby […]

headline: Birmingham City Women sign N.Ireland international Simone Magill
summary: Birmingham City have signed Northern Ireland international forward Simone Magill on a two-year deal following her departure from Aston Villa. She has over 75 caps and 25 goals for her country, joining Villa from Everton […]

headline: Crystal Palace Women sign Jorja Fox on season-long loan
summary: Crystal Palace have signed England U-23 international full-back Jorja Fox on a season-long loan from Chelsea. She has had previous loan spells with Charlton Athletic in the Championship and WSL rivals Brighton & Hove Albion, […]

headline: Liverpool Women sign Sweden U-23 forward Cornelia Kapocs
summary: Liverpool have signed Cornelia Kapocs on a permanent deal from Linkoping for whom she scored 18 goals last season. She spent four years with Linkoping, playing through the middle as well as out wide, also gaining […]

headline: Wales Women’s international Megan Wynne signs for Perth Glory
summary: A-League side Perth Glory have signed Welsh international winger Megan Wynne on a two-season deal following her departure from Southampton. The 31-year-old had joined the Saints in 2022, after spells at Watford, Millwall Lionesses, Tottenham […]

headline: Manchester City Women’s Gracie Prior signs four-year contract
summary: Academy graduate Gracie Prior has signed her first professional contract with Manchester City in a four-year deal. She made her senior debut in October 2022 but the 19-year-old defender has been on City’s books since […]

headline: London City Lionesses sign Teyah Goldie on season-long loan
summary: London City Lionesses have signed England youth international defender Teyah Goldie on a season-long loan from Arsenal. She has been capped at U-19 level by England, for whom she earlier skippered the U-15s, played a […]

headline: Women’s Professional Leagues Limited takes charge of top two tiers
summary: The Women’s Professional Leagues Limited has today taken over responsibility for the Barclays WSL and Championship from the FA. Each club participating in these leagues will act as a shareholder in the new company. The […]

headline: Cloé Lacasse departs Arsenal Women for Utah Royals
summary: Canadian international Cloé Lacasse has left Arsenal and joined NWSL side Utah Royals on a deal through to 2027. She signed for the Gunners from Benfica last summer, making a total of 28 appearances and […]

headline: Arsenal Women sign Swedish international forward Rosa Kafaji
summary: Arsenal have confirmed the signing of Swedish international forward Rosa Kafaji from BK Häcken on a long-term contract. She made 61 appearances and score 28 goals during her time at Häcken, finished as their top […]
